mods.note: ITHE BAHREIN PETROLEUM COMPANY LIMITED Bahrein Island, Persian Gulf, February 24, 1934. No. FA- 22, Visitors to SS ^£1 Segundo' Eis Pritannic rajesty's Political A£:ent, Bahrein. Dear Sir: As the Tanker SS w El Segundo' is here to do a very special job in a short length of time, Captain I. B. Smith and myself would like to limit the number of visit cars allowed aboard to the European residents, the shaikhs and their families, and the more important merchants. We have set aside Friday for visiting day. Europeans and Shaikhs will be welcome at any time without passes, but I think it would be advisable if all others would secure passes from you, from Mr. Belgrave, or from myself. I would appreciate your informing those concerned of the above arrangement, or I will do so myself if you prefer it. Yours very truly, E. A. SKENITER. B cc - Captain I. B. Smith, SS 'El Segundo'.■ ■ IS' No. 3 73 Political Agency, Bahrain, the 25th February 1934. To The Chief Local Representative, The Bahrain Petroleum Conpany Limited, 3 A H R A, I N > Dear Sir, f ^ «fith reference to your letter No*PA-22 dated the 24th February 1934 regarding visitors to the Tanker Ship ^ SI Segimdo, I beg to inform you that I have issued the Circular and Notice, of which I enclose a copy, and have requested the Adviser to the Bahrain Govemnent (a) to inform His Excellency Shaikh Hamad bin Msa U Khalifah and his family and (b) to issue a similar notice regarding passes. I 2. I have ventured to add that I think that it would be prudent for us to issue no passes to hawkers or petty tradesmen without previous reference to you. Yours faithfully, /i IfC Lieut-Colonel, Political Agent, Bahrain.J Political Agency, Bahrain, the 25th February 1934. - CIRCULAR, The Chief Local Representative of the Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited has asked me to state that, owing to pressure of work, he and Captain I.B.Smith find it necessary to limit the occasions on which visitors may go on board the Tanker Ship SI Segundo to Fridays, when any one who may wish to visit the ship will be welcome. In accordance with the arrangements reached verbally, I am sending round a notice to the British and American Community. 3 # i't is understood that you will inform ills -.xcellency Shaikh Hamad bin 'Isa M Khalifah atnd suggest to him that, if he or Shaikh Ubdullah, Shaikh Salman or Shaikh Rashid go to see the ship, they should send word ahead so that one aster may be able to make suitable arran ements. It would be wise I think t >v lesser members of the Family to get a pass from you to preclude any repetition of the unseemly Incident of a few days back. 4. It seems unlikely that the general public will wish uo go so far, but it would be well, as arranged, for you to put up a % notice saying that no one may go on board the ship without a uass from you or (in the case of foreign subjects) from ..e» A copy is enclosed of my notice# 6* I think that it would be prudent to give no parses to hawkers or petty tradesmen without previous reference to the Chief I^ocal Representative. The Political Agent, BAHHT5IW- Dear Sir, We shall te touch obliged if you will permit us to bring the HS.'^ORJISTAN' to the anchorage at Sitra for the purpose of discharging approximately 2000 pipes on ac count of The Bahrein Petroleum Company Ltd. At tiiis position, it will facilitate discnarge of the steamer owing to the fact tnat she will be anchored in sueltered waters, and owing to the fact that The Bahrein Petroleum Company Lta-, have a crane at Sitra worked by machinery. Sir, I hav^/xhe honour to acknowledge your letter No. 2300-28/5 dated December 24, 1935, regarding the request of the Deputy Manager, The Mesopotamia Persia Corporation, Ltd., Bahrain, that his company may discharge cargoes of certain vessels of Strick and Hansa lines at Sitrah. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 28/5 Visits of Tankers and other Ships to Sitrah'

physicalDescription.extent: The documents in the file are mostly arranged in chronological order. There are notes at the end of the file, (folios 238-254). The file notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file; they give brief description of the correspondence with a reference number, which refers back to that correspondence in the file.

The foliation starts on the first folio with 1 and continues to 254, which is the last number given to the last folio of the file. The numbering is in pencil in the top centre of recto (1-8), then in the top right corner.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Political Agent in Bahrain, the Financial Adviser to the Government at Bahrain, Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, and representatives of the Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited (BAPCO) on shipments of oil and movements of tankers and ships in and out of Sitra terminus.The file includes crew list for the first trip of the tanker El Segundo, and copies of Marine Delivery Tickets showing the amount of oil shipped from Sitra between 1935 and 1936.There are documents in Arabic.
